history.content: You're right, the notes don't do a good job by themselves teaching the content. That being said, do try to skim them so that formulas and concepts will seem a little more familiar when you encounter them in lecture. Check out the IMT Decal website (imt-decal.org), the homeworks and recorded lectures cover material that will be only minimally elaborated on in CS70 but are fundamental to the course. I found that the counting and probability practice helped a lot! To prepare for exams, take a lot of practice exams beforehand, that seems to help with this class as well as most others. Good luck! -- Everyone has their own approach to learning the material in 70. I disagree with the first poster; in my experience, the notes were all I needed to learn the material. You're absolutely correct that the notes are difficult to internalize, but be prepared to dedicate a lot of time to them. Reading math takes a lot more time than reading a story, and you shouldn't be surprised if it takes you multiple hours to learn the notes. Go over them slowly, convince yourself that each step in the proofs/explanations is correct, and don't move on until you have everything down thoroughly. Imo you'll get a lot out of the notes. As for the midterms/finals, the best strategy is probably just to do practice exams. I noticed especially with the T/F and short answers very similar questions tend to be repeated across years, and you'll get a lot faster at stuff just by practicing.

You're right, the notes don't do a good job by themselves teaching the content. That being said, do try to skim them so that formulas and concepts will seem a little more familiar when you encounter them in lecture. Check out the IMT Decal website (imt-decal.org), the homeworks and recorded lectures cover material that will be only minimally elaborated on in CS70 but are fundamental to the course. I found that the counting and probability practice helped a lot! To prepare for exams, take a lot of practice exams beforehand, that seems to help with this class as well as most others. Good luck!

Hi guys,

I am trying to prepare for CS70 for my fall semester. It seems that every note from previous semester is pretty long and difficult to comprehend/internalize. Any thoughts/advice on how to prepare well for this class? How about doing well in midterms and final? Any opinions would be highly appreciated. Thanks.
history.subject: How to succeed in CS70
